p: Correspondingly, these changes lead to substantial reductions in energy use and GHG emissions. Summarizing the climate mitigation impact of all three cities, the targeted trip changes lead to a reduction of about 290,000 t CO 2equ in the Green Mobility scenario and of almost 530,000 t CO 2equ in the Green Exercise scenario as displayed in Figure 4. For the Zero Emission scenario the switch from conventional engines to electric engines will lead to a reduction of CO 2equ of 1,000,000 t relative to the baseline (1,200,000 t in 2010, i.e., 12% of the Austrian emissions in the passenger transport sector). If electric power is produced in a carbon neutral manner, emissions are reduced to zero.
